edupack_tutorial.title: Sample Tutorial, TVB-EduPack v0.1.2
edupack_tutorial.description: In this example tutorial, you'll get a first impression of TVB-EduPack. The tutorial is divided to several parts. These parts are the Steps which you can see in the menu below. The first part is already open and shows you the associated Tasks. Click on the first task to continue.

sub-step.detail:
Welcome to The Virtual Brain - EduPack. :)
The first tasks of this Tutorial will present you the main features of TVB-EduPack. There is a lot to explore, click from Task to Task, learn which tools could be useful for you and continue by

finish_constraints.manual: clicking here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.detail:
In the upper part of TVB-EduPack menu you can find 3 different speech bubble elements with a checkbox.
You can activate and deactivate these elements if you need help in a specific TVB-interface. If you activate one of the elements, you will find these colored speech bubbles on several areas of the screen. Just click them, and an helping overlay with more information about this element will open right away.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: TVB-EduPack provides EduCases, like in Step 01: Pipeline Data which will guide you through the TVB-interface. Whenever you see the following highlighted elements in a task, you will also find a corresponding element on the screen. Marked with the current task number, indicating an important element or position where to continue.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: Some consecutive tasks require preconditions, like being in a aforesaid interface. In preparation of the next task, switch now to the Simulation Interface. And some tasks offer more detailed information, just click the Info button to learn more about the topic. You can close the overlay by double clicking in the grey background or on the x in the upper right corner.

overlay.content:
Preview results


Sometimes you will find a more detailed description about a topic, and sometimes you can find additional information, like the Preview of some simulation results:
Parameter exploration for two different noise levels.


Noise D = 0.5




Noise D = 0.75





Conclusion

Now close this window by clicking in the darkened background and complete the task.

finish_constraints.manual: Continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: As maybe recognized, the title of this task has a different color - related to the fact, that it has something to do with parameters (according to the TVB-parameter Helper). In the overlay, you will find precomputed results. Play with the sliders, adapt some parameters and learn about their influences. When you're done, you can submit the values of the parameters directly to the Simulation interface.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the Simulation Interface to continue.

overlay.content:
Neuronal activity, Power Spectrum and FC Matrices



Showing FC and PSD of Parameter Exploration of the parameters D (HeunStochastic Integrator), linear coupling value a and the conduction speed in order to get a good neural activity.


Noise level D
 1.0
Long-range coupling factor
 0.110
Conduction Speed
 40


Standard TVB Parameters, except:
Conduction Speed: varying
Local Dynamic Model: Stefanescu Jirsa 3D (TVB standard configuration)
Integrator: HeunStochastic
D: varying
monitors: subsample (5ms)
simulation length: 5 seconds

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: For the educational component of TVB we are providing describing animations. Get a first impression of this feature, by clicking on the video file.

animation.content: Introduction TVB-EduPack Animations
Long-range Connectivity Matrix Animation
Conduction Speed Animation
Long-range coupling function Animation

finish_constraints.manual: Continue with the next step and the upcoming Pipeline Import

sub-step.detail: For the educational component of TVB we are providing describing animations. Get a first impression of this feature, by clicking on the video file.

finish_constraints.manual: Continue with the next step and the upcoming Pipeline Import

sub-step.detail:
To start right away we want to import some data.
Therefore, please change to the Project Interface.
You can find the link in the footer menu.
sub-step.action:
This is the first task you have to solve,
click this Project button to switch to the Project Interface.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, you are not in the correct interface (Project)!
sub-step.action: The menu entry List of all projects will bring you to the project manager, where we can generate a new and clean project.
sub-step.detail:
Now you see all submenu options of the project interface.
We want to create a new project, so please change to
List of all projects.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, you are not in the correct interface (Project -> List of all Projects)!
sub-step.detail:
As probably recognized, the TVB-EduPack moved a little bit to the left.
Right to this window is the button Create new Project , click this and continue.
sub-step.action: Click Create new project and then we will create a new project.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, you are not in the correct interface (Project -> Create New Project)!
sub-step.detail:
Give your project
a name and a description and then continue by clicking
Save Changes
right next to the TVB-EduPack window.
sub-step.action: Please give your project a significant Name.
Please give your project a meaningful Description.
When the project is named, you can continue and Save Changes.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, you are not in the correct interface (Project -> List of all Projects)!
sub-step.detail:
Your created project should be automatically selected, indicated with
a dark star on the left.
Click on Project Data
in order to start importing new data structures.
sub-step.action: This is the indicator of your current selected Project.
Continue by clicking the Project Data button.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, you are not in the correct interface (Project -> List of all Projects)!
sub-step.detail:
Now you are in the Data structure menu, where you can handle all imported, adapted or simulated data. We want to create a new subject and
Upload on the left. data, so click the button right to the menu and continue.
sub-step.action: Click the button, and then we will continue with uploading different data structures.

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, you are not in the correct interface (Project -> List of all Projects)!
sub-step.detail:
Continue uploading the files from the brainmodes_data folder from your TVB directory. Make sure that you're uploading the data in the correct order and for the same subject - because of data dependencies.
1. Connectivity Matrix .zip file
2. Surface Cortex from .zip file
3. Face Cortex from .zip file
4. EEG Cap from .zip file
5. EEG Sensors Location from .txt file
6. RegionMapping from .txt file
7. Projection Matrix from .mat file

finish_constraints.manual: Click here when you're finished.

sub-step.detail:
In the following section, you will find precomputed results which can be directly forwarded to the simulator interface.
Please change to the Simulator interface before you continue.

finish_constraints.manual: Continue with the following task.

sub-step.detail: This section will show you the FC matrices of a pre-run simulation for 9 different Long-range couling factors a. The other parameters were estimated through parameter space exploration within TVB.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:
Functional Connectivity of BOLD 150s



Long-range coupling factor
 0.12
Conduction Speed
 40


Standard TVB Parameters, except:
Conduction Speed: 40
Local Dynamic Model: Stefanescu Jirsa 3D (TVB standard configuration)
Integrator: HeunStochastic
D: 0.75
monitors: BOLD, subsample (5ms)
HRF kernel: mixture of gammas
BOLD sampling period 2000ms
simulation length: 150 seconds computation time (each): approx. 7 hours

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: This section will show you the 150 seconds BOLD signal of 15 regions and the FC matrices of a pre-run simulation for 9 different Long-range couling factors a. The other parameters were estimated through parameter space exploration within TVB.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:
Functional Connectivity and BOLD signal 150s


Long-range coupling factor
 0.12
Conduction Speed
 40


Standard TVB Parameters, except:
Conduction Speed: 40
Local Dynamic Model: Stefanescu Jirsa 3D (TVB standard configuration)
Integrator: HeunStochastic
D: 0.75
monitors: BOLD, subsample (5ms)
HRF kernel: mixture of gammas
BOLD sampling period 2000ms
simulation length: 150 seconds computation time (each): approx. 7 hours

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.task: View Neuronal activity, Power Spectrum and FC Matrices
sub-step.detail: Here you see an example of parameter exploration.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: SJ3D Parameter Exploration for linear coupling factor a and conduction speed, in order to simulate neural activity.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:
pics_5s_subs_d075_a004_02_cs20_40_60 - Neuronal activity, Power Spectrum and FC Matrices

Integrator: HeunStochastic
D: 0.75
monitors: subsample (5ms)
simulation length: 5 seconds

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.detail: Parameter Exploration for BOLD activity and with different values for linear coupling factor a and conduction speed in SJ3D.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:
150s BOLD, SJ3D - BOLD activity and FC Matrices



Parameter Exploration for BOLD activity and with different values for linear coupling factor a and conduction speed in SJ3D.

Long-range coupling factor
 0.13
Conduction Speed

Standard TVB Parameters, except:

Local Dynamic Model: Stefanescu Jirsa 3D (TVB standard configuration)
Integrator: HeunStochastic
D: 0.75
monitors: BOLD
simulation length: 150 seconds

Submit Data      

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to continue with the next task.

sub-step.task: Showing FC, PSD and neural activity
sub-step.detail: Showing FC, PSD and neural activity of Parameter Exploration of the parameters D (HeunStochastic Integrator), linear coupling value a and the conduction speed in order to get a good neural activity.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

sub-step.detail: Showing FC and PSD of Parameter Exploration of the parameters D (HeunStochastic Integrator), linear coupling value a and the conduction speed in order to get a good neural activity and with the possibility to compare values in two frames.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:
pics_5s_subs_d075_10_25_a004_001_02_cs20_20_60 - Neuronal activity, Power Spectrum and FC Matrices



Showing FC and PSD of Parameter Exploration of the parameters D (HeunStochastic Integrator), linear coupling value a and the conduction speed in order to get a good neural activity.
User the two different result frames to compare the data of different parameter ranges and submit the one you like most to the TVB Simulator Interface.

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.

sub-step.task: SJ3D: K11 and K12 Parameter Exploration
sub-step.detail: Parameter Exploration of the parameters K11 and K12 from Stefanescu Jirsa 3D, to get a higher frequency in the neural activity.
sub-step.precondition: <font color=red>Warning</font>, please switch to the simulator interface, otherwise you can not submit the selected data.

overlay.content:
pics_15s_D075_a012_cs100_K11_0_5_K12_0_25 - Neuronal activity, Power Spectrum and FC Matrices



The goal was to find a higher frequency in the neural activity by adapting the parameters K11 and K12 from the Stefanescu Jirsa 3D model.

Standard TVB Parameters, except:
Long-range coupling function: linear
a: 0.12
b: 0.0
Conduction Speed: 100
Local Dynamic Model: Stefanescu Jirsa 3D
Integrator: HeunStochastic
D: 0.75
monitors: subsample (5ms)
simulation length: 15 seconds
K11
2.5  
K12
1.25

Submit Data

finish_constraints.manual: Click here to complete this task manually.
